    1. of(MappingResult, ConversionResult.Failure.ErrorType, ConversionResult.ConversionContext)

Interface ConversionResult<T>

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the result
All Known Implementing Classes:
ConversionResult.Failure, ConversionResult.Success
public sealed interface ConversionResult<T> permits ConversionResult.Success<T>, ConversionResult.Failure<T>

Represents the final result of a type conversion.

Example:

switch (result) {
    case ConversionResult.Success<Object>(Object success) -> ...; // proceed with converted object
    case ConversionResult.Failure<Object> failure -> log(failure);
}
See Also:
  • Proteus.convert(Object, Type, Type)

    static <T> @NotNull ConversionResult<T>

  • Method Details

    • of

      @NotNull static <T> @NotNull ConversionResult<T> of(@NotNull @NotNull MappingResult<T> result, @NotNull ConversionResult.Failure.ErrorType errorType, @Nullable @Nullable ConversionResult.ConversionContext context)
      Creates a new ConversionResult with the given input.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the result
      Parameters:
      result - the MappingResult to create the ConversionResult from. This is either a MappingResult.Success from the very last step or a MappingResult.Failure from any step that failed
      errorType - the ConversionResult.Failure.ErrorType to use if the given MappingResult is a MappingResult.Failure
      context - the ConversionResult.ConversionContext, can be null if this ConversionResult wasn't created during conversion
      Returns:
      the newly created ConversionResult
